intro: Rondeletia brachistantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. Rondeletia brachistantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
